abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column recalls memorable home runs hit by Hall of Fame inductees Ken Griffey Jr and Mike Piazza, neither of whom has won World Series; describes back-to-back home runs by Griffey and his father Ken Griffey Sr while playing together for Seattle Mariners in 1990 and two-run homer hit by Piazza at Shea Stadium in first New York game after Sept 11 terrorist attacks.
lead_paragraph: Neither Ken Griffey Jr. nor Mike Piazza ever won a World Series, but each slugger smashed a home run that is destined to remain a part of baseball lore.

headline.main: With Two Homers, Emotions Go Deep for Ken Griffey Jr. and Mike Piazza
headline.print_headline: With Two Homers, the Emotions Go Deep

snippet: Neither Ken Griffey Jr. nor Mike Piazza ever won a World Series, but each slugger smashed a home run that is destined to remain a part of baseball lore.
